1: I’m so glad to hear that! My purpose today was to provide you with some helpful advice that you can use in the next steps of resolving your denial issue.
2: Lastly, I’ve located some additional resources on this topic that may be useful for you to reference in the future.
3: [Coverage Access Guide: Making the most of your insurance 365 days a year](http://www.patientadvocate.org/requests/publications/CAG_MaximizingInsurance_FINAL_Web.pdf). Tips on how to maximize your insurance coverage
4: [Coverage Access Guide: Common Roadblocks to Care](http://www.patientadvocate.org/requests/publications/CAG_CommonObstacles_web.pdf). Discusses frequent insurance challenges and ways to combat them
5: [Negotiating Medical Costs](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Negotiating-Medical-Costs.pdf). Some quick tips for saving money before and after medical care
6: [Out of network care: The ins and outs of going out of your plan’s network of providers](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Seeking-Out-of-Network-Care.pdf). A handy guide for when going out of network may be necessary
7: I wish you the best with your healthcare journey moving forward.
